title: Need help with Fontlab batch conversions, bug in action set preferences
content:
I am using the action set tool in Fontlab 5.0.4 Mac to convert batches of Windows Type 1 fonts to Opentype using the method Adam suggested in [this thread.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201031018/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37555) There’s a problem with this method; widths all stay set to normal, and style names all stay set to regular. This means that in Indesign, no matter what I turn on, I only see the real normal weight.

I have tried finding a setting that will allow me to automatically build the names in the preferences option but I don’t see one. This brings up another problem: it seems like this option should be under the General section of the preferences; trying to access that menu crashes Fontlab but leaves it running (I can’t even send a report to Apple).

Any suggestions?

 [‹ Proper Python/RoboFab Installation on Mac OS x 10.5 Leopard?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201031018/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39317 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can't compile/generate OpenType in FontLab 5.0.0 (WinXP) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201031018/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39191 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Puckett

comments.content:
There is no such option, unfortunately. I guess Python scripting might be your best bet.
